definition: (old) servant hired to keep guard, run errands etc

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: One day in spring, Wang Liangbin called his servant to him.
sentences.chinese: 春天里的一天，王亮宾把他的家丁叫到跟前。

sentences.english: There will be accommodation for 600 personal servants and staff.
sentences.chinese: 这座豪华官邸将可容纳600个家丁和工作人员栖身。

sentences.english: Dongpo to rescue season often, but into house surrounded by a Chen Fu assume soon.
sentences.chinese: 东坡欲救出季常，但潜入屋不久后被陈府家丁包围。

sentences.english: Operators Run to notice the fields of the GuDing.
sentences.chinese: 跑去通告地里干活的家丁们。

sentences.english: I am sure you have thought a great deal more than the generality of servants think.
sentences.chinese: 我想，比起通俗的家丁而言，你必定要有设法多了。

sentences.english: Money is no more than our servish.
sentences.chinese: 金钱不过是我们的家丁。

sentences.english: Everyone is a master and a servant.
sentences.chinese: 每小我既是主人，又是家丁。

sentences.english: Then he had the servants serve a feast for their honored guest.
sentences.chinese: 接着他呼吁家丁们设宴款待嘉宾。

sentences.english: He waved the servant out of his room.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手叫家丁分开房间。

definition: forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
bailiff responsible for catching criminals (in imperial China)
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
